page.title: 11Farming
page.content: {Market gardening}has declined as a major agricultural practice of the{Lea {Valley.}Most nurseries are now{garden {centres}and grow house and garden plants. {Picks Farm}(3896) and{ {Netherhouse Farm}(3897) both adjacent to the busy A112, have recently reorganiseds on a{Pick Your Own}basis, growing soft fruits and some vegetables, mainly lettuce. Otherwise the farmland is predominantly {"improved" pasture,}grazed by cattle. Some land is cultivated for cereal crops.{Bury Farm}(3996) is a{riding {stable.}Its paddocks are grazed by horses.{Right of common}on{Forest {land}is exercised by some local farmers. Their cattle roam freely. Sheep keep the grass on the banks of the{reservoir}closely cropped.
